author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In th'Occitan meadow, gaunt and drear,
The oil's sharp decline we hear,
As Chine's feeble gesture doth unfold,
Piercing the land's heart, now e'er so cold.

In the realm of Thailand's fervent sphere,
The Bank's ardent fight against inflation revere,
A leap of twenty-five points to tame the wild,
Inflation's fierce tempest thus beguiled.

Amidst the labyrinthine world of base metals, low,
Weak China demand doth Shadows sow,
In the grip of reck'ning that lingers still,
Affecting the land with price's will.

feedItems.title: Oil Holds Sharp Declines After China PMI Data
feedItems.description: Oil prices fell 0.2% in Europe after weak Chinese economic data, and markets are worried the country’s commodity demand is weakening more quickly than anticipated, Commonwealth Bank said.

feedItems.title: Bank of Thailand Raises Rate to Tame Inflation
feedItems.description: Thailand’s central bank increased its policy rate by 25 basis points to 2.00% as it continued its efforts to tame inflation.

feedItems.title: Base Metals Lower as Weak China Demand Weighs on Prices
feedItems.description: Industrial metal prices were weaker with China’s disappointing economic recovery continuing to weigh on the demand outlook, according to ANZ.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of dollar rise and equity weak,
The Fed doth turn the wheels we seek,
In haven's safety, we confide,
As Unicredit's words provide.

In distant France, the goods inflate,
Consumers see a lesser rate,
With food and energy impaired,
A lighter burden is declared.

Behold the tale of Handelsbanken wide,
In Finnish lands, a deal's tides abide,
To S-Bank, Fennia, and Oma's gain,
A sum so vast, a billion doth attain.

feedItems.title: Dollar Rises on Fed Rate Expectations, Weak Equities
feedItems.description: The dollar was higher in European trading due to growing expectations the Fed will continue raising rates and falls in equity markets which increase demand for safe havens, UniCredit Research said.

feedItems.title: French Inflation Eases
feedItems.description: France’s consumer price index rose by 5.1% on year in May, a lower than expected print, helped by falling energy, food and services prices.

feedItems.title: Handelsbanken Secures Deal to Sell Bulk of Finnish Business
feedItems.description: Handelsbanken has agreed to sell parts of its Finnish operations to S-Bank, Oma Savings Bank and Fennia Life Insurance for around €1.3 billion.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the realm where Nikkei lays,
The dragon of trade breathes its malaise,
Fortunes down, steelmakers grieve,
Clouds of doubt the sky doth weave.

To fair Eurozone's vast tide,
Inflation slows, bond yields confide,
Their steady course to ebb and sway,
An uncertain storm shall rule the day.

A weakened foot upon China's shore,
Dulled are steel's fierce fangs of yore,
In factories dark and trade winds mild,
Growth recedes like ocean’s wild.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 1.4%, Dragged by Trading Houses, Steelmakers
feedItems.description: The Nikkei closed down 1.4%, dragged by declines in trading houses and steelmakers, as profit-taking kicked in on continued uncertainty over the inflation and economic outlook.

feedItems.title: Slowdown in Inflation Set to Drive Eurozone Bond Yields Lower
feedItems.description: The inflation-driven rally in eurozone rates markets looks set to continue with national CPI data likely to slow markedly, Commerzbank said.

feedItems.title: China's Recovery Slows Further as Factory, Services Activity Pulls Back
feedItems.description: China’s factory activity contracted for a second straight month while growth in the services sector slowed.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In deepest grief, a web is spun,
For lives once bright now darkly dim,
Boeing's mea culpa won,
In anguished hearts, a mournful hymn.

Forsooth, on yonder Chicago's streets,
A vile tempest of hate doth rage,
Disinvestment's trauma repeats,
As sorrow floods the mortal stage.

A query looms 'pon parchment scribed,
Whither goes this land's vast refrain?
In debt's cruel grip we're described,
A tempest shrouds our futures' bane.

feedItems.title: Boeing 737 MAX Victims' Families Can Seek Compensation for Pain and Suffering, Judge Rules
feedItems.description: The aircraft maker has admitted responsibility for the 2019 crash, but has contested factoring victims’ precrash pain and suffering into damages.

feedItems.title: Another Shoot-'em-Up Memorial Day Weekend in Chicago
feedItems.description: The city’s new mayor attributes shootings to the ‘trauma’ of disinvestment.

feedItems.title: Where Is the U.S. Economy Headed? Follow the Money
feedItems.description: Debt markets, where lenders funnel money to businesses and consumers, are showing signs of strain.
